story:
Once upon a time, in a lush and vibrant village in Nigeria, there lived a kind-hearted little girl named Ada. Ada was known throughout the village for her bright smile, her infectious laughter, and her boundless curiosity. She loved to explore the world around her, asking questions and seeking answers to everything she saw.

One day, Ada discovered a tiny, delicate bird with beautiful feathers of every color, perched upon a low-hanging branch in her family's courtyard. She had never seen a bird quite like this one before, and she was immediately enchanted.

"Good day, little bird," Ada said, gently approaching the creature. "Where do you come from, and why are your feathers so magnificent?"

The bird looked at Ada with its bright, intelligent eyes and spoke in a soft, musical voice. "I am a unity bird, young one. My feathers represent the unity and harmony of all the different tribes and cultures that make up our beautiful nation, Nigeria. I have traveled far and wide, from the rivers of the Niger Delta to the rolling hills of the Jos Plateau, and I have seen firsthand the beauty and strength that comes from our diversity."

Ada was fascinated. "Tell me more about this unity, little bird. How can we all live together in harmony when we are so different?"

The unity bird spread its wings wide, allowing Ada to see the full spectrum of colors that adorned its feathers. "Each feather on my body represents a different tribe, culture, or language in Nigeria. But although we may look different on the outside, we all share the same hopes, dreams, and desires for our families, our communities, and our nation. When we come together and celebrate our differences, we create a stronger, more resilient society."

Ada thought about this for a moment. "But what if some people do not want to celebrate our differences? What if they wish to harm or exploit those who are not like them?"

The unity bird sighed. "Sadly, there will always be those who seek to divide us, young one. But we must not let their hatred and fear win. Instead, we must stand together, lift each other up, and show the world that we are stronger and more powerful when we work as one."

Ada nodded, her eyes filled with determination. "I will do my best to promote unity and harmony in our village, little bird. I will encourage my friends and family to celebrate the diversity that makes us unique and special."

The unity bird smiled, its eyes twinkling with approval. "That is the spirit, Ada. Now, I must continue my journey, spreading the message of unity and harmony wherever I go. But I will never forget the kindness and curiosity you have shown me today."

With that, the unity bird took flight, leaving Ada to ponder the wisdom she had shared. From that day on, Ada dedicated herself to promoting unity and harmony in her village, organizing festivals and events that celebrated the diverse cultures and traditions of her fellow villagers. And although she never saw the unity bird again, she knew that its spirit lived on in the hearts and minds of all those who believed in the power of unity and the beauty of diversity.

And so, Ada grew up to be a wise and compassionate leader, inspiring countless others to embrace their differences and work together for a brighter, more harmonious future. And they all lived happily ever after, united in their love for their fellow man and their beautiful, diverse nation.

As you drift off to sleep tonight, dear daughter, remember the story of Ada and the unity bird. Let it serve as a reminder that despite our differences, we are all connected by our shared hopes, dreams, and the desire to live in a peaceful, harmonious world. Goodnight, sweet dreams, and may you always be a force for unity and love in the world around you.
